snippet: Mayor Bob Filner sees the border as a potential economic engine for the region, a remarkable shift in a city once viewed as a hotbed for illegal immigration.
abstract: San Diego is courting a deeper relationship with Tijuana, Mexico, and embracing the Mexican border as an economic engine for region; effort has been led by Mayor Bob Filner, who has opened a satellite office in Tijuana and is seeking to streamline border crossings; movement has encountered almost no political opposition, marking stark change from earlier period in which preventing illegal immigration was top priority.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bob Filner sees the border as a potential economic engine for the region, a remarkable shift in a city once viewed as a hotbed for illegal immigration.

headline.seo: San Diego Mayor Building Economic Bridges to Tijuana
headline.main: San Diego Mayor Building Economic Bridges to Tijuana
headline.print_headline: Building Ties To a Neighbor On the Border
